Draw the following lines to form a rectangle: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.313, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.313, 0.0], End Point [0.313, 0.1565] * Line 3: Start Point [0.313, 0.1565], End Point [0.0, 0.1565] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.1565], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Close the loop and scale the sketch with a factor of 0.313. Extrude the sketch with a depth of 0.0049 towards the normal and 0.0 in the opposite direction. **Part 2: Construct a second rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0049] Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Draw the same rectangle as in Part 1, by repeating the same lines and loop. Close the loop and scale the sketch with a factor of 0.313. Extrude the sketch in the opposite direction of the normal, with a depth of 0.0049 and 0.0 in the other direction. Part 1 and Part 2 together form a rectangular prism with a diagonal cut through it, creating two triangular voids. * The length of each rectangular prism is 0.313 units. * The width of each rectangular prism is 0.313 units. * The height of the entire CAD model is 0.0049 units.</description>
